creator: Syretia
text:
- Not a recommended Linux distro due to on-again, off-again security concerns.
- Maintains separate repositories for all software (including kernel), often out of date compared to the upstream Debian equivalents.
- Repositories are not well maintained. Deepin repos have been known to included things that can't be redistributed along with other weird things. For example, Blank's no longer maintained Discord wrapper was in their repos for quite some even though the official Linux Discord client was available at the time.
- Until recently, transmitted data on screen size, IP addresses, and physical location of users in plaintext through the Deepin App Store (relevant video).

[Kubuntu](https://kubuntu.org) provides [Deepin look and feel packages](https://store.kde.org/p/1243751/) (see <div emoji="`{prefix}info kubuntu`" style="display:none;"/>[Kubuntu](#kubuntu)).

See <div emoji="`{prefix}info recommended`" style="display:none;"/>[Recommended](#recommended) for a list of recommended distros.
